question: Linear regression belongs to which category of machine learning?
If you predict housing prices based only on the size of each house, which regression is this?
In the regression model y = a + bx, what does 'b' represent?
Which of the following are assumptions of linear regression?
Which metrics can be used to evaluate a linear regression model?
What does the coefficient of determination (R-squared) represent?
options: The proportion of variance in the dependent variable explained by the model
The slope of the regression line

question: In multiple linear regression, what does 'multicollinearity' refer to?
options: Correlation between dependent and independent variable

question: Which of the following can help address multicollinearity?
Which method is commonly used to fit the best line in linear regression?
What does the intercept in a linear regression model represent?
options: The value of x when y is zero
The value of y when all predictors are zero

question: Which of the following are true about adjusted R-squared?
options: It penalizes the addition of irrelevant predictors
It can decrease if a new predictor does not improve the model
It is always greater than R-squared
It is used in multiple regression

question: In the model Y = α + β1X1 + β2X2 + ... + ε, which regression is this?
Which of the following can be consequences of violating linear regression assumptions?
What is the main difference between simple and multiple linear regression?
options: Simple uses one predictor, multiple uses more than one
Simple is unsupervised, multiple is supervised
Simple uses categorical variables, multiple uses continuous

question: Which statement is true about the residuals in linear regression?
options: They should be correlated with predictors
They should be normally distributed with mean zero
They should be as large as possible

question: Which of the following are types of regularization used in regression?
What is the effect of adding irrelevant features in multiple linear regression?
options: It may increase R-squared but decrease adjusted R-squared
It always decreases both R-squared and adjusted R-squared

question: Which of the following is NOT an assumption of linear regression?
Which of the following are ways to check for homoscedasticity?
Which of the following best describes the bias-variance tradeoff in regression?
options: Balancing model complexity to avoid underfitting and overfitting
Minimizing training error at all costs
